newsitem.title: MALAWI: Malawi not ready to offer asylum to Rwanda refugees.
newsitem.headline: Malawi not ready to offer asylum to Rwanda refugees.

text.p: Malawi will not offer asylum to Rwandans escaping repatriation from Zaire or Tanzania, Foreign Minister George Ntafu said on Wednesday night.

Ntafu, in a statement on national radio, accused the U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) of breaking promises to launch an afforestation programme to restore Malawi's degraded environment after it hosted Mozambican refugees.

"They just lied to us. Not even a single dollar has come to us," Ntafu said. He said more than 1.8 million Mozambican refugees who lived in Malawi for eight years denuded the country of its forests, leaving most of the land bare.
Ntafu added that hosting Mozambicans had been easy as they shared similar cultural beliefs with Malawi, unlike Rwandans and others from central African countries.
A UNHCR representative in Malawi said between 80 and 100 suspected Rwandans has crossed into Malawi from Tanzania in the last two weeks.
